title: Making Music Out Of The Coronavirus
description: When Markus Buehler heard about the coronavirus, he wanted to know what it sounded like. Today on the show, Maddie speaks with Short Wave reporter Emily Kwong about how Markus Buehler, a composer and engineering professor at MIT, developed a method for making music out of proteins, and how music can potentially help us hear what we have trouble seeing at the nanoscale level.

itunes:title: Making Music Out Of The Coronavirus
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: MIT engineering professor Markus Buehler explains his method for making music out of proteins, including the spike proteins that surround the coronavirus.
itunes:subtitle: MIT engineering professor Markus Buehler explains his method for making music out of proteins, including the spike proteins that surround the coronavirus.
